snippet: The investigation begun by the International Criminal Court chief prosecutor came two weeks after the Palestinians joined the treaty that created the court.
abstract: International Criminal Court opens preliminary investigation into possible war crimes committed in Palestinian territories, which could lead to charges against Israel; move comes two weeks after Palestinians signed treaty to accept jurisdiction of the court; Israel condemns action and says it will not cooperate with inquiry.

byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and ISABEL KERSHNER
byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone reported from New York, and Isabel Kershner from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: The investigation begun by the International Criminal Court chief prosecutor came two weeks after the Palestinians joined the treaty that created the court.

headline.main: Court to Look Into Possible Israeli War Crimes in Palestinian Territories
headline.print_headline: Court to Look Into Possible Israeli War Crimes in Palestinian Territories

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
